occurrences.text: all of these things and we find that He's a deceiver. Remember when we first started this particular series, we talked about the fact that Eve was deceived. This is the oldest tool in the toolbox of Satan, that of deception. The reality is that we can be deceived ourselves. In 1 Corinthians 3 and verse number 8, the simple statement that is given in Scripture where the Bible… In verse number 18, excuse me, where the Bible says, let no man deceive himself. Let no man deceive himself in 1 Corinthians 3 and verse number 18. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool that he may be wise. And he talks about the wisdom of God and how we need God's wisdom. Let no man deceive himself. Listen, we're not seeking to use the world's wisdom, we're seeking to use God's wisdom. And we need to know the Word of God and so we see the problem as we begin looking at these verses of Scripture in Galatians 6, verses 7 and 8, that the problem is deception. Be not deceived. Then God gives us this principle, really principles that are provided to us within the remainder of verse 7 and verse number 8. This principle or these principles that are given, we've used the title this evening, sowing and reaping, and we'd understand that this law, if you will, is a self-evident principle
